definition: Eileen Chang (1920-1995), famous Chinese-American novelist
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
(onom.) ting-a-ling (in compounds such as 玎玲 or 玲瓏|玲珑)/tinkling of gem-pendants

sentences.english: Both Zhang Ailing and Wang Anyi have strong female awareness.
sentences.chinese: 张爱玲与王安忆都有着鲜明的女性意识。

sentences.english: This paper reveals that most females in Zhang Ai-lings novels have pastoral consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 本文论述张爱玲笔下的女性大多拥有牧歌意识。

sentences.english: He Eileen Chang said he would not emergency, but to be a pseudonym to hide for some time.
sentences.chinese: 张爱玲他表示，他不紧急，但要化名隐藏一段时间。

sentences.english: Zhang ailing' reception history has long time and big span.
sentences.chinese: 张爱玲的接受历史时间长，跨度大。

sentences.english: She created a hybrid way of artistic expression, too, to deal with the subject.
sentences.chinese: 张爱玲擅用比喻，其艺术处理也是一种混杂的手法。

sentences.english: This article tries to reread A Love Story in The Ruined City from the aspect of receptive aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 试图从接受美学的角度解读张爱玲的《倾城之恋》。

sentences.english: Ailing Zhang and Tong Su and the Ugly on the value of women have a common expression.
sentences.chinese: 张爱玲和苏童对女性审丑价值有着共同的体现。

sentences.english: This text understand to Zhang Ailing's float generation joys and sorrows from literature.
sentences.chinese: 本文从文学角度解读张爱玲小说里的浮世悲欢。

sentences.english: Zhang Ailing is that one was born in the strange woman in troubled times.
sentences.chinese: 张爱玲就是一个生于乱世的奇女子。

sentences.english: The female costumes are described elegantly with rich connotation in Zhang Ailing and Su Qing's novels.
sentences.chinese: 张爱玲与苏青小说中的女性服饰描写细腻，内涵丰富。

sentences.english: Chang's most famous works include Lust, Caution and Love in a Fallen City.
sentences.chinese: 张爱玲最著名的小说包括《色戒》和《倾城之恋》。

sentences.english: Changhengge by Wang Anyi shows similarities with Zhang Ailing's novels.
sentences.chinese: 王安忆的《长恨歌》表现出与张爱玲小说的相似性。

sentences.english: To explain Sigmond·Frued's theories was the main contents of ZHANG Ai-ling's works.
sentences.chinese: 诠释弗洛伊德学说是张爱玲作品的主要内容。

sentences.english: The female consciousness of Zhang Ailing is showed in her narration .
sentences.chinese: 张爱玲的女性意识，就在她的叙事中表现了出来。

sentences.english: Eileen Changs prose thus often describes the inner bleakness of its characters.
sentences.chinese: 张爱玲的散文多处依靠听觉实现对内心苍凉感的描绘。

definition: Xiao Hong (1911-1942), prominent woman writer, originally from Heilongjiang
Xu Zhimo (1897-1931), writer and poet
Shen Congwen (1902-1988), novelist
Qian Zhongshu (1910-1998), literary academic and novelist, author of the 1947 novel Fortress Beseiged 圍城|围城
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Maugham (family name)/W. Somerset Maugham (1874-1965), English writer
Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Bai Xianyong (1937-), Chinese-Taiwanese-US novelist of Hui descent
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Kawabata Yasunari, Japanese literature Nobel laureate
George Bernard Shaw (1856-1950), Irish dramatist and writer
Mandarin ducks and butterfly (i.e. love birds) literary school around 1900, criticized as populist and romantic by socialist realists
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
